summary:
"Look farther and command shorter, feline and nimble, be supple on your back feet"​ (my father's quote)

Enabling a cohesive and efficient workforce structure connecting research & development, product, and application groups to extend capabilities/opportunities to better serve company’s customers and key technology trends

profile_positions.description:
The thesis, entitled "Computational Lithography for Advanced Logic/SRAM nodes", had the principal objective to understand, quantify and optimize the printability performance of real Logic chips at advanced technology nodes (N20 and N10), which was articulated around three main aspects:
- OPC (optical Proximity Correction) and EPC (Etch Proximity Correction) towards PPC (Process Proximity Correction),
- Design and Multi-Patterning decomposition towards DTCO (Design Technology Co- Optimization),
￼- Contour extraction and EPE/Area metrics towards Metrology.

Supervisors: Dr. Kristin De Meyer (imec, KUL), Dr. Peter De Bisshop (imec).

Stopped before completion.

Teaching: Teaching assistant making, supervising and correcting evaluation tests of 3rd year BSc students for a course at KU Leuven, Semiconductor Components, under the direction of Dr. Guido Groeseneken (imec, KUL) and Dr. Paul Heremans (imec, KUL), 2013-2015.
profile_positions.title: Ph.D. candidate

profile_positions.description:
Mentor Graphics assignee (and RIT student) working in modeling in the field of Extreme Ultraviolet Lithography (EUVL), and 193nm Immersion Lithography technologies through Calibre software tools.

Supervisors: Dr. John Sturtevant (Mentor Graphics), Dr. Geert Vandenberghe (imec), Dr. Bruce W. Smith (RIT).
